snippet: Six world powers agreed to lift sanctions on Iran in exchange for Iranian limits on its nuclear program, but they left open areas sure to raise objections in Congress, like the nation’s ability to produce as much fuel as it wishes after Year 15.
abstract: Iran and group of six countries including United States achieve historic deal to significantly limit Iran's nuclear capabilities for more than decade in return for lifting international oil and financial sanctions; Pres Obama vows accord is based on verification, not trust.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Iran, Dan Bilefsky from London, and Gardiner Harris from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Six world powers agreed to lift sanctions on Iran in exchange for Iranian limits on its nuclear program, but they left open areas sure to raise objections in Congress, like the nation’s ability to produce as much fuel as it wishes after Year 15.

headline.sub: In 10 Years, Period Needed for Weapon Would Shrink
headline.main: Deal Reached on Iran Nuclear Program; Limits on Fuel Would Lessen With Time
headline.print_headline: World Leaders Strike Agreement With Iran to Curb Nuclear Ability and Lift Sanctions
